name: TeamHelper
description: The `TeamHelper` class provides access to Minecraft scoreboard team information within JsMacros scripts. This class allows you to interact with teams, including retrieving team properties, member lists, colors, and visibility settings. Teams are typically used in multiplayer environments to group players and apply specific rules and formatting.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Returns the raw team name used internally by Minecraft (Since: 1.3.0)

methods.name: getDisplayName
methods.description: Returns the team's display name with formatting codes preserved (Since: 1.3.0)
examples:
let displayName = team.getDisplayName();
Chat.log("Team display: " + displayName.getString());

methods.name: getPlayerList
methods.description: Returns an array list containing all players currently assigned to this team (Since: 1.3.0)

methods.name: getColorFormat
methods.description: Returns a FormattingHelper object containing the team's color formatting information (Since: 1.8.4)
examples:
let colorFormat = team.getColorFormat();
Chat.log("Color code: " + colorFormat.getCode());

methods.name: getColorIndex
methods.description: Returns the numeric color index used by Minecraft's formatting system (Since: 1.8.4)

methods.name: getColorValue
methods.description: Returns the actual RGB color value, or -1 if the team has no specific color (Since: 1.8.4)

methods.name: getColorName
examples:
let colorName = team.getColorName();
Chat.log("Team color: " + colorName);

methods.name: getColor
methods.description: Deprecated method that returns the same value as `getColorIndex()` (Deprecated Since: 1.8.4 - Use `getColorIndex()` instead)

methods.name: getScoreboard
methods.description: Returns the ScoreboardsHelper object for the scoreboard containing this team (Since: 1.8.4)
examples:
let scoreboard = team.getScoreboard();
let allTeams = scoreboard.getTeams();

methods.name: getPrefix
methods.description: Returns the prefix that appears before team member names (Since: 1.3.0)
examples:
let prefix = team.getPrefix();
Chat.log("Team prefix: " + prefix.getString());

methods.name: getSuffix
methods.description: Returns the suffix that appears after team member names (Since: 1.3.0)
examples:
let suffix = team.getSuffix();
Chat.log("Team suffix: " + suffix.getString());

methods.name: getCollisionRule
methods.description: Returns how team members can collide with each other. Possible Values: `"always"`, `"never"`, `"pushOtherTeams"`, `"pushOwnTeam"` (Since: 1.3.0)

methods.name: isFriendlyFire
methods.description: Returns true if team members can damage each other (Since: 1.3.0)

methods.name: showFriendlyInvisibles
methods.description: Returns true if team members can see invisible teammates (Since: 1.3.0)

methods.name: nametagVisibility
methods.description: Returns how team member nametags are displayed. Possible Values: `"always"`, `"never"`, `"hideForOtherTeams"`, `"hideForOwnTeam"` (Since: 1.3.0)

methods.name: deathMessageVisibility
methods.description: Returns how death messages for team members are displayed. Possible Values: `"always"`, `"never"`, `"hideForOtherTeams"`, `"hideForOwnTeam"` (Since: 1.3.0)

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a formatted string containing basic team information (Override: Yes)
examples:
let teamString = team.toString();
// Output example: TeamHelper:{"name": "ยง6Red Team"}
